item.title: 特朗普借鉴习近平住房政策手册
item.description: 美国总统计划严控私人住房投资，此举与中国采取的措施相呼应。【原文：The US president aims to crack down on investment in private housing, echoing China’s moves】

item.title: Fairfax增持安德玛股份，深化"加拿大伯克希尔"战略布局
item.description: Fairfax Financial Holdings Ltd.收购Under Armour Inc.的大量股份后，这家陷入困境的服装制造商的股价已部分回升。这家加拿大保险公司采取的投资策略与伯克希尔·哈撒韦公司的投资策略颇为相似。【原文：Fairfax Financial Holdings Ltd.’s acquisition of a big stake in Under Armour Inc. has seen the struggling apparel-maker’s shares stage a partial comeback, as the Canadian insurance firm builds on a playbook akin to Berkshire Hathaway Inc.’s investment strategy.】

item.title: 捷克央行因克朗升值录得35亿美元亏损
item.description: 捷克央行在连续两年盈利后，于2025年出现亏损，原因是克朗升值的影响抵消了外汇储备带来的创纪录收入。【原文：The Czech central bank posted a loss in 2025 after two profitable years as the impact of a stronger koruna outweighed record income generated by its foreign currency reserves.】

item.title: 泰国考虑限制黄金投机交易以保护泰铢
item.description: 泰国将对黄金投机交易实施限制，当局正加大力度遏制贵金属创纪录涨势对本国货币的影响。【原文：Thailand is set to impose limits on speculative trading in gold as authorities step up efforts to curb the influence of a record-breaking rally in the precious metal on the nation’s currency.】

item.title: 即便在华纳兄弟引发抛售后，奈飞股价仍显昂贵
item.description: 自10月以来，奈飞公司股价持续下跌。当时这家流媒体巨头被视为华纳兄弟探索公司的潜在收购方之一。尽管不到三个月内股价暴跌27%，但该股票似乎仍因估值过高而难以吸引投资者。【原文：Shares of Netflix Inc. have tumbled since October, when the streaming giant became one of the presumed suitors for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. But despite a 27% plunge in less than three months, the stock still appears to be too expensive to entice investors.】

item.title: 特朗普能否通过对抗华尔街买家来降低房价？
item.description: 唐纳德·特朗普总统承诺禁止华尔街投资者购买独栋住宅，此举仿佛是为饱受多年住房危机困扰的消费者打了一记反击拳。但专家们立即质疑，此类禁令能否有效缓解美国许多社区的高房价和供应短缺问题——甚至可能使情况恶化。【原文：President Donald Trump’s pledge to bar Wall Street investors from buying single-family homes had the feel of a counterpunch on behalf of consumers frustrated by a yearslong housing crisis. But experts immediately questioned whether such a ban would do much to alleviate the high prices and supply shortages in many American communities — or even make them worse.】

item.title: InPost在收购提案后从落后者跃升为行业领头羊
item.description: 波兰包裹柜运营商InPost SA因收购提议推动股价创下有史以来最强劲的周涨幅，使这家2025年欧洲表现最差的公司之一一跃成为领涨股。【原文：A takeover approach has propelled shares of Polish parcel-locker operator InPost SA to their strongest weekly gain on record, turning one of Europe’s biggest underperformers of 2025 into its leading stock.】

item.title: 俄军"奥列什尼科夫"导弹袭击旨在实施"战略胁迫"
item.description: 击中乌克兰城市利沃夫的俄罗斯"奥列什尼克"弹道导弹未携带爆炸物，且未击中任何具有军事价值的目标，这表明其意图在于施压而非造成重大破坏。【原文：The Russian Oreshnik ballistic missile that hit the Ukrainian city of Lviv carried no explosives and hit nothing of military value, implying it was meant to coerce rather than inflict major damage.】

item.title: 特朗普购入MBS为交易员提供买入长期债券的理由
item.description: 通过要求房利美和房地美购买2000亿美元抵押贷款债券，美国总统唐纳德·特朗普再次展现出其压低关键市场利率的决心，并间接向美联储施加压力。【原文：By asking Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to purchase $200 billion in mortgage bonds, US President Donald Trump is showing once again his determination to keep down key market interest rates and, indirectly, apply pressure to the Federal Reserve.】

item.description: 对于质疑美国股市在强劲上涨后还能攀升多少的怀疑者，市场中一股主导力量依然坚定看涨：散户投资者。【原文：For skeptics questioning how much further US stocks can climb after a blockbuster run, one of the market’s dominant forces remains decisively bullish: individual investors.】

item.title: 力拓称若收购嘉能可或考虑持有煤炭资产
item.description: 知情人士透露，力拓集团表示，若与嘉能可的合并谈判成功，将考虑保留嘉能可庞大的煤炭业务。【原文：Rio Tinto Group is open to retaining Glencore Plc’s massive coal business if merger talks between the two companies are successful, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 信实工业股价暴跌6%，财报发布前遭遇新年重挫
item.description: 信实工业有限公司今年开局遭遇重挫，股价下跌逾6%，投资者正消化疲软的零售前景以及美国对印度购买俄罗斯石油的强硬言论——这使得即将公布的财报肩负起遏制股价下跌的重任。【原文：Reliance Industries Ltd. is off to bruising start to the year, with shares down more than 6% as investors digest weak retail outlooks and tougher US rhetoric on India’s Russian oil purchases — putting the onus on upcoming earnings to arrest the slide.】

item.title: 据称，国防公司Vincorion计划于第一季度启动首次公开募股（IPO）。

item.title: 马斯克的Grok将图像生成功能限制为X平台付费用户

item.title: 英国国债有望创下数月来最佳单周表现，因市场押注英国央行将放松政策推动债券价格上涨
item.description: 英国国债年初强势反弹，因英国政府正逐步减少长期借款，而疲软的通胀数据则助推了市场对英国央行降息的预期。【原文：Gilts are rallying to start the year as the UK government shifts away from long-term borrowing and weaker inflation fuels bets on Bank of England interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 据称沃达丰Idea正考虑通过举债来推动增长
item.description: 知情人士透露，在印度政府决定对历史频谱使用费的年度支付额设限后，沃达丰爱立信有限公司正考虑通过债务融资加速业务增长。【原文：Vodafone Idea Ltd. is considering raising debt financing to accelerate growth, people familiar with the matter said, following the Indian government’s decision to cap annual payouts for past spectrum fees.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉海上滞留石油因美国干预而激增
item.description: 在美方扣押委内瑞拉领导人尼古拉斯·马杜罗并控制该国能源资源后，海上漂浮的委内瑞拉原油量已飙升至三年多来的最高水平。【原文：The volume of Venezuelan crude floating at sea has spiked to the highest level in more than three years after the US seized the country’s leader, Nicolas Maduro, and asserted control over its energy resources.】

item.title: 印度前顾问称关税上调将危及印度经济
item.description: 印度前首席经济顾问阿文德·苏布拉马尼安在接受采访时表示，印度经济尚未显现强劲复苏迹象，而美国提高关税的风险以及中国低价商品倾销加剧可能削弱经济前景。【原文：India’s economy is not showing signs of a robust recovery and the risk of higher US tariffs as well as increased dumping of low-cost Chinese goods could weaken the outlook, former Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian said in an interview.】

item.title: IAG更换财务总监，吉百利将于六月离职
item.description: 英国航空母公司IAG SA宣布，首席财务官尼古拉斯·卡德伯里将于年中离职。【原文：IAG SA, the parent of British Airways, said Chief Financial Officer Nicholas Cadbury will step down and leave the group in the middle of the year.】

item.title: 万科启动债务重组计划，迈向违约
item.description: 知情人士称，应监管部门要求，中国万科正筹备债务重组方案，这使得这家国内最大房地产开发商之一更接近违约。【原文：China Vanke Co. is preparing a debt restructuring plan at the request of authorities, people familiar with the matter said, pushing one of the country’s largest real estate developers closer to default.】

item.title: RRJ资本为首只私募信贷基金筹集11亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，由前高盛集团银行家创立的私募股权公司RRJ Capital，通过其首支专注亚太地区投资的私募信贷基金首轮融资，已筹集11亿美元资金。【原文：RRJ Capital, a private equity firm founded by a former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. banker, raised $1.1 billion via the first round of financing for its debut private credit fund focusing on investments in Asia Pacific, according to people familiar with the matter.】
